column5:
1:mic testing finished,0:mic testing not finished
set as 0 will call the mic testing process
1 bit as one mic result, 1: ok, 0: fail.if all mic is ok, will return 0x7f
[-100..100 dB] initial loudspeaker signal input gain
[0..4]:      0: normal operation, 1: bypass with spk processing, 2: pure bypass
[0..4] left shift of microphone input signal
[-80..0]:    threshold below which echo removal is put to maximum
[0..40]:     when ERLE < aec_noise_thr, then noise echo is not cancelled
[0..40]:     when ERLE > aec_dt_thr in dB, then doubletalk release will be disabled
[0..24]:     during near-end and doubletalk echo removal is released [dB]
[-80..0]:    maximum echo attenuation when ERLE < aec_dt_thr [dB]
[0, 1]:      0: aec echo path estimation on, 1: set echo path to aec_gain
[-60..20]:   echo path initial gain (if aec_noadapt then update aec gains to aec_gain) [dB]
[0, 1]:      0: audio gain control off, 1: audio gain control on
[0, 1]:      0: audio gain control off, 1: audio gain control on
Peak value of microphone signal before AEC [dBfs]

column1: REPORT_AUTO FOR VOICE ANGLE AND VAD STATE
